title: Capital- BA
description:
What impact will you make?




Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. As the undisputed leader in professional services, Deloitte is where you’ll find unrivaled opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.




Deloitte is where you’ll find unrivaled opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.




The Team

Discover the various Financial Risk services, we offer to help organizations across the full life cycle of financial transaction. From governance and processes to technology and reporting, our services can enhance transparency, efficiency, compliance, and financial integrity.







Work you’ll do




Capital Reporting expertise:




Lead the development and delivery of regulatory capital reports to relevant authorities according to established deadlines and standards (e.g., Basel III, Pillar 3 reports).
In-depth understanding of key capital adequacy ratios like Tier 1 capital, total capital ratio, and risk-weighted assets (RWA).
Monitoring regulatory changes and implementing necessary adjustments to reporting processes.
Draft, analyze, and maintain BRDs for regulatory programs, ensuring alignment with regulatory objectives.
Facilitate workshops and discussions with stakeholders to gather requirements effectively.
Participate in Agile ceremonies, including sprint planning and retrospectives, to enhance project delivery.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement solutions that improve treasury operations.
Utilize Qlik and Qlik Sense for data visualization to present insights on liquidity and risk metrics.
Conduct ad-hoc analysis as required to support treasury initiatives.




Key Responsibilities:




Requirement Gathering & Analysis

Work with business stakeholders, including finance, treasury, risk management, and compliance teams, to gather and document capital reporting requirements.
Analyze current capital reporting processes and systems, identifying areas for improvement or automation.
Translate business requirements into functional specifications for technical teams.

Capital Reporting Process Design

Design and document efficient capital reporting workflows, ensuring data accuracy and timeliness.
Ensure that reporting outputs align with internal and regulatory requirements, such as capital adequacy, liquidity, and solvency ratios.
Collaborate with IT and data teams to define data structures, reporting formats, and delivery methods.

System Implementation & Support

Act as a liaison between business users and technical teams to ensure smooth implementation of capital reporting solutions.
Participate in testing and validation of capital reporting systems to ensure that reports meet business needs and regulatory standards.
Provide ongoing support and troubleshooting for capital reporting tools and systems.

Documentation & Training

Create and maintain detailed documentation for capital reporting processes, system configurations, and user guides.
Train end-users on new or updated capital reporting tools and processes.

Data Analysis & Reporting

Analyze data sources and reporting outputs to ensure consistency and accuracy of capital reporting metrics.
Provide insights into capital reporting trends and performance, helping to drive business decision-making.

Stakeholder Communication

Regularly communicate with senior management and stakeholders on project progress, challenges, and solutions.
Collaborate with external auditors, regulators, and other third parties as necessary for capital reporting purposes.

Continuous Improvement

Stay updated on changes in capital reporting regulations and industry best practices.
Recommend and implement improvements to the capital reporting process and system functionality.




Requirements:




Education: Bachelor’s degree in finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field. An MBA is preferred.
Experience: 5 to 10 years of experience as a Business Analyst in financial services, specifically focusing on Capital reporting.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in Qlik and Qlik Sense for data analysis and reporting.
Analytical Skills: Excellent analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data.
Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to present findings clearly to stakeholders.
Methodology Knowledge: Familiarity with Agile methodologies and experience working in Agile environments.




Your role as a leader




At Deloitte India, we believe in the importance of leadership at all levels. We expect our people to embrace and live our purpose by challenging themselves to identify issues that are most important for our clients, our people, and for society and make an impact that matters.




In addition to living our purpose, Assistant Manager across our organization:




• Builds own understanding of our purpose and values; explores opportunities for impact

•Demonstrates strong commitment to personal learning and development; acts as a brand

ambassador to help attract top talent

• Understands expectations and demonstrates personal accountability for keeping performance on track

• Actively focuses on developing effective communication and relationship-building skills

• Understands how their daily work contributes to the priorities of the team and the business




How you’ll grow




At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help build world-class skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing




business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs at Deloitte University, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career. Explore Deloitte University, The Leadership Centre.
